zh-cn: 米哈伊尔·亚历山德罗维奇·巴枯宁

description.zh-cn: 俄国思想家、革命家、社会主义者、无政府主义者。他被认为是无政府主义最具影响力的人物之一，是集体无政府主义理论的主要创立者。
description.en: Russian thinker, revolutionary, socialist, and anarchist. He is considered one of the most influential figures in anarchism and the main founder of the theory of collectivist anarchism.

description.zh-cn: 德国哲学家、经济学家、社会学家、政治理论家、记者和革命社会主义者。他在第一国际中与巴枯宁存在严重分歧，并最终将巴枯宁开除出协会。
description.en: German philosopher, economist, sociologist, political theorist, journalist and revolutionary socialist. He had serious disagreements with Bakunin in the First International and eventually had him expelled from the association.

description.zh-cn: 法国社会主义者、政治家、哲学家、经济学家，第一位称自己为“无政府主义者”的人。他的思想对巴枯宁产生了巨大影响。
description.en: French socialist, politician, philosopher, economist, and the first person to call himself an 'anarchist'. His ideas had a great influence on Bakunin.

nodes.id: 亚历山大·伊万诺维奇·赫尔岑

zh-cn: 亚历山大·伊万诺维奇·赫尔岑

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家、思想家、哲学家和革命家。巴枯宁的朋友，曾借钱给巴枯宁，并一同为《钟》杂志撰稿。
description.en: Russian writer, thinker, philosopher, and revolutionary. A friend of Bakunin, he lent money to Bakunin and they worked together on the journal 'Kolokol' (The Bell).

description.zh-cn: 俄国小说家、诗人和剧作家。他与巴枯宁是朋友，并以巴枯宁为原型创作了小说《罗亭》。
description.en: Russian novelist, poet, and playwright. He was a friend of Bakunin and used him as the prototype for the novel 'Rudin'.

description.zh-cn: 德国哲学家，德国唯心主义的集大成者。其哲学思想对巴枯宁产生了重要影响。
description.en: German philosopher, a major figure in German idealism. His philosophical ideas had a significant influence on Bakunin.

description.zh-cn: 俄国文学评论家、思想家、革命民主主义者。巴枯宁在莫斯科时期的朋友。
description.en: Russian literary critic, thinker, and revolutionary democrat. A friend of Bakunin during his time in Moscow.

description.zh-cn: 即第一国际，一个旨在联合各种左翼社会主义、共产主义和无政府主义政治团体和工会组织的国际组织。巴枯宁于1868年加入，后因与马克思派的斗争于1872年被开除。
description.en: Also known as the First International, an international organization which aimed to unite a variety of different left-wing socialist, communist and anarchist political groups and trade union organizations. Bakunin joined in 1868 and was expelled in 1872 due to his conflict with the Marxist faction.

description.zh-cn: 一个由巴枯宁及其追随者在被开除出第一国际后于1872年成立的无政府主义国际组织。
description.en: An anarchist international organization founded in 1872 by Bakunin and his followers after their expulsion from the First International.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪德国的一个哲学思潮和知识分子团体，对黑格尔的哲学进行激进的解读。巴枯宁早期曾是其中一员。
description.en: A philosophical movement and intellectual group in 19th-century Germany that radically interpreted Hegel's philosophy. Bakunin was a member in his early years.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁出生时期的俄罗斯政权。因其革命活动，俄罗斯帝国当局没收其财产，并对他进行长期监禁和流放。
description.en: The Russian state at the time of Bakunin's birth. Due to his revolutionary activities, the authorities of the Russian Empire confiscated his property and subjected him to long-term imprisonment and exile.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪的一个德意志邦国。1849年，巴枯宁在德累斯顿起义失败后被萨克森当局逮捕并判处死刑。
description.en: A German state in the 19th century. In 1849, after the failure of the Dresden uprising, Bakunin was arrested by the Saxon authorities and sentenced to death.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪中欧的一个多民族帝国。巴枯宁被从萨克森引渡后，奥地利当局同样判处他死刑。
description.en: A multinational empire in Central Europe in the 19th century. After Bakunin was extradited from Saxony, the Austrian authorities also sentenced him to death.

description.zh-cn: 一种革命性的无政府主义学说，主张废除国家和生产资料的私有制，并代之以生产者自己的集体所有制和控制。巴枯宁是该理论的主要创立者。
description.en: A revolutionary anarchist doctrine that advocates the abolition of the state and private ownership of the means of production, replacing them with collective ownership and control by the producers themselves. Bakunin was the main founder of this theory.

description.zh-cn: 由卡尔·马克思和弗里德里希·恩格斯创立的社会、政治和经济理论。巴枯宁是马克思主义及其无产阶级专政思想的著名批评者。
description.en: A social, political, and economic theory originated by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels. Bakunin was a prominent critic of Marxism and its idea of the dictatorship of the proletariat.

description.zh-cn: 马克思主义理论中的一个概念，指由无产阶级掌握国家政权。巴枯宁对此持强烈反对态度，预言它将变成对无产阶级的专政。
description.en: A concept in Marxist theory where the proletariat holds state power. Bakunin was strongly opposed to it, predicting it would become a dictatorship over the proletariat.

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家屠格涅夫创作的小说，其主人公形象的原型是米哈伊尔·巴枯宁。
description.en: A novel by Russian writer Ivan Turgenev, whose protagonist was based on Mikhail Bakunin.

description.zh-cn: 1848年欧洲各国爆发的一系列武装革命，是欧洲历史上规模最大的革命运动。巴枯宁曾积极参与在捷克地区的叛乱。
description.en: A series of armed revolutions that broke out in various European countries in 1848, the largest revolutionary wave in European history. Bakunin actively participated in the rebellion in the Czech lands.

description.zh-cn: 国际工人协会的一次代表大会，会上巴枯宁派与马克思派的斗争达到顶峰，最终导致巴枯宁被开除。
description.en: A congress of the International Workingmen's Association where the conflict between the Bakuninist and Marxist factions culminated, leading to Bakunin's expulsion.

description.zh-cn: 位于俄罗斯特维尔州的一个村庄，是米哈伊尔·巴枯宁的出生地。
description.en: A village in Tver Oblast, Russia, the birthplace of Mikhail Bakunin.

description.zh-cn: 瑞士的首都，米哈伊尔·巴枯宁于此地逝世。
description.en: The capital of Switzerland, where Mikhail Bakunin passed away.

description.zh-cn: 位于圣彼得堡的一所军事院校，巴枯宁曾在此接受军事训练。
description.en: A military academy in Saint Petersburg where Bakunin received military training.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯帝国的精锐部队。巴枯宁在离开炮兵学校后曾在此担任低级军官。
description.en: The elite troops of the Russian Empire. Bakunin served as a junior officer here after leaving the artillery school.

description.zh-cn: 14岁时前往圣彼得堡，在炮兵大学（即米哈伊洛夫炮兵学校）接受军事训练，1834年因成绩不佳被开除。
description.en: At the age of 14, he went to Saint Petersburg and received military training at the Artillery School (Mikhaylovskaya Military Artillery Academy), from which he was expelled in 1834 for poor performance.

description.zh-cn: 在莫斯科学习哲学期间，巴枯宁与别林斯基等人结为友人。
description.en: During his philosophy studies in Moscow, Bakunin befriended Vissarion Belinsky and others.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁系统学习了德国观念论哲学，并逐渐深受黑格尔影响，还翻译了他的著作。
description.en: Bakunin systematically studied German Idealist philosophy and became increasingly influenced by Hegel, also translating his works.

description.zh-cn: 1844年巴枯宁在巴黎结识了普鲁东，后者对他产生了巨大影响。
description.en: In 1844, Bakunin met Proudhon in Paris, who greatly impressed and influenced him.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁与马克思在巴黎相识，但两人在革命理论、第一国际组织原则等问题上存在根本分歧，最终决裂。他们的斗争主导了1872年海牙大会。
description.en: Bakunin and Marx met in Paris, but they had fundamental disagreements on revolutionary theory, the organizational principles of the First International, and other issues, which eventually led to a split. Their struggle dominated the Hague Congress of 1872.

description.zh-cn: 在1872年海牙大会后，马克思因认为巴枯宁在国际工人协会内组建秘密组织而将他开除出协会。
description.en: After the Hague Congress of 1872, Marx had Bakunin expelled from the International, accusing him of forming a secret society within it.

description.zh-cn: 因其激进倾向，俄国政府命令其归国，遭拒后没收其财产。后被引渡回俄国，先后囚禁于彼得保罗要塞和什利谢利堡要塞，并于1857年被流放至西伯利亚。
description.en: Due to his radicalism, the Russian government ordered him to return, and confiscated his property upon refusal. He was later extradited to Russia, imprisoned in the Peter and Paul Fortress and Shlisselburg Fortress, and exiled to Siberia in 1857.

description.zh-cn: 1849年在开姆尼茨被捕后，被萨克森王国当局判处死刑，后减为无期徒刑并于1850年6月引渡至奥地利。
description.en: After being captured in Chemnitz in 1849, he was condemned to death by the government of Saxony. The sentence was later commuted to life imprisonment, and he was handed over to the Austrian authorities in June 1850.

description.zh-cn: 从萨克森引渡后，被奥地利当局再次判处死刑，后减为无期徒刑并于1851年5月引渡至俄罗斯。
description.en: After being extradited from Saxony, he received another death sentence from the Austrian authorities, which was also commuted to life imprisonment. He was finally handed over to Russian authorities in May 1851.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁是集体无政府主义理论的主要创立者。
description.en: Bakunin is the main founder of the theory of collectivist anarchism.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁是马克思主义的著名批评者，他反对无产阶级专政，并预言马克思主义的政权将对无产阶级进行专政。
description.en: Bakunin was a famous critic of Marxism; he opposed the dictatorship of the proletariat and predicted that a Marxist regime would become a dictatorship over the proletariat.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁曾参与1848年在捷克布拉格的叛乱。
description.en: Bakunin participated in the 1848 insurrection in Prague, Czech lands.

description.zh-cn: 屠格涅夫是小说《罗亭》的作者。
description.en: Turgenev is the author of the novel 'Rudin'.

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家屠格涅夫以其朋友巴枯宁为原型创作了小说《罗亭》。
description.en: Russian writer Ivan Turgenev used his friend Bakunin as the prototype for the protagonist of his novel 'Rudin'.

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁于1840年在柏林结识屠格涅夫，两人成为朋友。
description.en: Bakunin met Turgenev in Berlin in 1840, and they became friends.

relationships.target: 亚历山大·伊万诺维奇·赫尔岑

description.zh-cn: 巴枯宁与赫尔岑是朋友，曾向其借钱，并在伦敦一同为《钟》杂志撰稿。
description.en: Bakunin and Herzen were friends; Bakunin borrowed money from him, and they collaborated on the journal 'Kolokol' (The Bell) in London.
